meanings.definition: A fine, powdery starch made from the endosperm of corn, used as a thickening agent in cooking.
meanings.sent1: I added cornstarches to the soup to make it thicker.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for cornstarches to thicken the sauce.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chef accidentally spilled cornstarches all over the kitchen!
meanings.sent4: Her cooking skills were like cornstarches, subtly enhancing the flavors.
meanings.sent5: The cloud of cornstarches in the air made the kitchen look magical.

meanings.definition: To coat or dust with cornstarch.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cornstarches the chicken before frying it.
meanings.sent2: The baker cornstarches the dough to prevent sticking.
meanings.sent3: The magician cornstarches his hands before performing a trick.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's shoes were cornstarched for better grip on the court.
meanings.sent5: The artist cornstarches the canvas before starting a new painting.
